sentences: Ma pean veel mitmeid dokumente täitma.
context: The Estonian verb 'täita' has multiple related meanings depending on context. It can mean 'to fill in' (like forms or documents), 'to fulfill' (obligations, promises), 'to complete' (tasks, requirements), or 'to satisfy' (needs, conditions). The word is commonly used in administrative contexts when completing paperwork, but also more generally to describe completing tasks or meeting obligations. It belongs to the -ida verb group and can be conjugated with different suffixes depending on tense and subject.
